channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on April 25
item.description:
April 25, 2020 8:17 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Saturday, April 25.

item.title: Coronavirus: Freeing up bed space in hospitals
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

A facility being built at Tanjong Pagar Terminal is the latest to be prepared to house Covid-19 patients or foreign workers.

item.title: 897 new cases and 9 new coronavirus clusters identified
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

There were nine new Covid-19 clusters announced yesterday as the total number of cases in Singapore crossed 12,000 - even as small positive signs started to emerge.

item.title: Coronavirus: Courts to hear only essential, urgent cases till June 1
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

The courts in Singapore will continue to hear only essential and urgent matters until June 1, in tandem with the one-month extension of the circuit breaker measures to slow the spread of the coronavirus.

item.title: More patients being placed face down to improve oxygen flow
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Patients lying face down on their stomachs in hospital beds have needed less oxygen support than those lying on their backs.

item.title: How climate change is linked to coronavirus response
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Climate change may have some bearing on the way the world responds to the Covid-19 pandemic, even though it may not have directly caused it, the World Health Organisation (WHO) said on Wednesday.

item.title: Coronavirus: $22m set aside to help tourism sector prepare for recovery
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

The Singapore Tourism Board (STB) has set aside $22 million to help tourism businesses market their services and build demand for when global travel resumes.

item.title: Coronavirus: Sufficient shelter space in S'pore for homeless, says minister
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

There is currently sufficient safe shelter capacity in Singapore, with 700 spaces available for the homeless, Minister for Social and Family Development Desmond Lee said in a Facebook post yesterday.

item.title: Molecular ninja: How a virus hijacks the body, one cell at a time
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

From drinking hot water to eating garlic, "cures" for Covid-19 abound on the Internet.

item.title: Coronavirus: State Courts turn away 7 visitors daily on average amid tighter rules
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

When Fiona Poh Min, one of three accused who turned up at the State Courts for the expected verdict of the O-level examination cheating case earlier this month, she was denied entry by security staff for showing symptoms of being unwell.

item.title: Covid-19 survivors, healthcare staff in new Stay At Home, S'pore video
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Two weeks after the catchy remake Stay At Home, Singapore was released, the generosity of Singaporeans has seen more than $135,000 raised for children and youth from low-income families.

item.title: Coronavirus: 400 denied entry to markets for turning up on wrong day
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Just over 400 people were turned away yesterday morning for not following stricter entry limits at four popular markets, said the National Environment Agency (NEA).

item.title: 9 in 10 coronavirus patients in Singapore housed in isolation facilities
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Community facilities now house 9,878 patients - out of the 11,107 current patients.Â

item.title: Coronavirus: Joylicious dorm operator given stern warning for locking up 20 workers
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

A dormitory operator who forcibly confined 20 workers in a locked room has been given a stern warning by the Ministry of Manpower (MOM).

item.title: Coronavirus: Tokyo Olympics among postponed stamp issues
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

All new national stamp issues from April to June, as well as the Tokyo Summer Olympics stamp issue, will be postponed, said SingPost yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Social workers roped in to coax seniors to stay home
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Social workers have been roped in to persuade seniors who are out and about to stay at home as the circuit breaker measures are tightened to further stem the spread of Covid-19.

item.title: Hotels, tourist guides step up to help fight coronavirus
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Businesses in the tourism sector have stepped up to help in the fight against Covid-19 despite the significant challenges they face, the Singapore Tourism Board's (STB) chief executive Keith Tan said yesterday.

item.title: Fasting, giving alms key to meaning of Ramadan: Minister
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Ramadan and Hari Raya Aidilfitri will not be the same this year amid the coronavirus outbreak, but the fundamentals of fasting and giving alms stand true, said Minister-in-Charge of Muslim Affairs Masagos Zulkifli.

item.title: MOH suspends officer for alleged leak of coronavirus figure, reviews processes
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

The Ministry of Health (MOH) said yesterday that it has suspended one of its officers after she allegedly leaked the number of new daily coronavirus cases in Singapore and retrieved a Covid-19 patient's records without authorisation.

item.title: Tills ringing for smaller online grocers as demand surges
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Given the difficulty that shoppers have had with booking delivery slots from big supermarket chains such as FairPrice and Giant, smaller online grocery providers are picking up the slack.

item.title: A meal before start of Ramadan fast
Coronavirus: Masagos lauds Muslim leaders' early decision to close mosques
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

As Singapore grappled with rising numbers of coronavirus infections earlier this year, the country's Muslim religious leaders unanimously agreed to close the mosques, a move applauded by Minister-in-Charge of Muslim Affairs Masagos Zulkifli.

item.title: Mid-sized supermarts and chains get a fillip; small minimarts struggle
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

In Mr Faisal Mohamathu's minimart in Tanjong Pagar, tinned food and instant noodles fill the shelves while bags of rice and toilet paper are neatly stacked at the back.

item.title: What children miss most while confined to home
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Standing at the window of her grandparents' Housing Board flat in Choa Chu Kang, eight-year-old Nasya Danial Cheng poses with a drawing that shows what she misses most as she stays indoors amid the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: Looking out for workers in over 1,100 smaller facilities a looming challenge
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

With an inter-agency task force moving quickly to address the needs of migrant workers in big dormitories, a looming challenge is to look out for migrant workers in smaller housing facilities scattered all over the island.

item.title: Resale, rental volumes of HDB flats fall in first quarter
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Resale and rental volumes of Housing Board flats fell in the first quarter of this year amid the ongoing coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: A much quieter Ramadan, but still very special
Coronavirus: Mask wearing a must in future for hawkers and food handlers
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

One legacy of the hygiene and sanitary practices adopted during the fight against Covid-19 will be the wearing of masks by hawkers and food handlers in the future.

item.title: Coronavirus: Scientists tap AI to find optimal drug combinations
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

A group of researchers in Singapore are tapping artificial intelligence (AI) to figure out the optimal dosage of drugs that can be used in combination for the treatment of Covid-19 patients.

item.title: Coronavirus: Support for Muslim workers at dorms during holy month of Ramadan
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Local dormitory operators under the Dormitory Association of Singapore will work closely with the Islamic Religious Council of Singapore (Muis) and the Government to support the religious needs of Muslim migrant workers during the month of Ramadan, the Ministry of Manpower (MOM) said yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Safe distancing rule-breakers also put families at risk, says Masagos
item.description:
April 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Those who disregard safe distancing measures are putting not just themselves but also their families at risk of Covid-19 infection, Minister for the Environment and Water Resources Masagos Zulkifli said yesterday.
